miscs.name: NL Spa Reine Flat Mineral Water
NL Spa Reine Flat Mineral Water

hops.notes: Pink grapefruit, citrus rinds, dried roses, pine resin, tropical fruits and sage. Previously called HBC 692.
hops.substitutes: HBC 692 is an experimental hops cultivar developed by the Hop Breeding Company. HBC 692 resulted from a hybrid pollination of the cultivar Sabro-HBC 438 and open pollination.
hops.name: Talus (HBC 692) (T90)
hops.usedIn: Wheat Ale, Golden Ale, American style lagers, Pale Ales, India Pale Lager (IPL), India Pale Ale (IPA), Session IPA, New England IPA, Imperial IPA.

hops.notes:
Sister to the well-known experimental HBC 472, Sabro exhibits many of the same characteristics, such as the coconut aroma. It imparts a strong and complex fruit flavour to beer, and has been described as having a mango, grapefruit, lemon grass and wood aroma, as well as the unique coconut.
PEDIGREE
“Unique cross pollenatoin with female neomexicanus ”
RECOMMENDED BEER STYLES
American Pale Ale/Cream Ale, IPA, NEIPA, Porter, Stout
KEY FLAVOURS
Tangerine, coconut, tropical and stone fruit with hints of cedar
TOTAL OIL COMPOSITION
Alpha w/w – 12.0-16.0%
Beta w/w – 4-7%
Total Oils mls/100gm – 2.5-3.0
Cohumulone – 20-24% of alpha acids
Myrcene (of total oil) – 55-65%
Caryophyllene (of total oil) – 11-13%
Humulene (of total oil) – 8-10%
Farnesene (of total oil) – <1%
hops.name: Sabro (HBC 438) (T90)

hops.substitutes: HBC 692 is an experimental hops cultivar developed by the Hop Breeding Company. HBC 692 resulted from a hybrid pollination of the cultivar Sabro-HBC 438 and open pollination.

fermentables.notes: Belgian Biscuit malt and the title suggest adds a bready, biscuit aroma and flavour. Can be used in many beer styles, up to 10% is recommended.
fermentables.name: Biscuit Malt

fermentables.notes: Head retention and lacing – dry biscuity flavour.
fermentables.name: Pale Wheat Malt
fermentables.usedIn: Wheat beers and adjunct for ales up to 40% of grist.

mashFermentables.name: Biscuit Malt

mashFermentables.name: Pale Wheat Malt
mashFermentables.usedIn: Wheat beers and adjunct for ales up to 40% of grist.

yeasts.name: Hophead Ale
yeasts.description: M66 Hophead Ale Yeast is a yeast and enzyme blend that has been designed to promote a hop forward, fruity profile – perfect for contemporary IPAs from New England to West Coast styles. Dry hop character will be enhanced along with aroma from any fruit additions made during fermentation. The moderate, well balanced ester profile from this yeast will complement New World hop character very well whilst also bringing out some malt character. This yeast ferments clean and relatively neutral with a moderate, well-balanced ester profile adding subtle complexity. Beers fermented with this yeast will finishing moderately dry but retaining a good level of mouthfeel to prevent them being too thin. With good alcohol tolerance up to 10% ABV, this yeast works particularly well in stronger IPA styles. Higher ABV beers will retain a good level of body without being too heavy. Sprinkle contents directly onto a maximum of 23 L(6 US Gal) of wort. Suitable to ferment 18-22°C (64-72°F). Store below 10 °C (50 °F)
